fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • The clue for 3 down in Monday’s Quick crossword (No 14,897, 5 February, page 16, G2) said: “Person using 9 (5)”. It was meant to be: “Person using 7 (5)”. • A reader tells us that after 34 years of entering the cryptic crossword competition, he finally won, only for us to spell his surname incorrectly. Our congratulations, and apologies, to John Gray of York (Puzzles, 29 January, page 12, Journal). • Other recently corrected articles include: Jeremy Corbyn pledges rebirth of ‘municipal socialism’ in the UK The magical realism of Santa Cruz del Islote - photo essay Heirs to the throne: five players who could be next Messi or Ronaldo
